data.text: Finnair Plus members are willing to invest in their future travels, despite the current situation. Finnair Plus had its most successful points campaign ever in November. 3,000 people bought points, with an average transaction of 72,000 award points. https://t.co/56SAP1Xqsx

Did you know you can spend your Finnair Plus points on hotel stays, food delivery or stylish homeware? Find out what other Finnair Plus members spent their award points and cash on last year. https://t.co/c4bDVAxhYz

data.text: In February, Finnair carried 87,300 passengers, which was 91.6% less than in February 2020. https://t.co/HUsWnF9gmR

Many people have changed their Finnair Plus password after we told about a data breach. Our servers have occasionally been busy because of this. Password change is a precautionary measure and it's not urgent. The breached data cannot be used to access your Finnair Plus account.

data.text: RT @arihuusela: It’s the manual work, at take off and during landing, that he loves. That sense of being in control is, he says, what he ge…

After over 100 days at sea, the finish line is in sight for Finnair A350 pilot @arihuusela. Ari has been racing in the Vendée Globe since November 2020. We wish Ari good luck for the final stretch! https://t.co/j1rebLg5K9
Flying with kids during the pandemic? Flying during the pandemic looks and feels a bit different, so it pays to prepare kids well ahead of time about what they can expect. https://t.co/lclGrJZe1Z

We've received several enquiries about whether it's possible to buy parts of our A319 aircraft that will be recycled in Finland. Dismantling aircraft parts and removing them from aviation usage is strictly regulated. Here's why you can't buy them ➡️ https://t.co/X2wLECKqxP

Due to construction work, traffic arrangements will change at Helsinki airport from 2 March until early December. You can no longer drive in front of Terminal 2 by taxi or car, and all drop-off and pick-up traffic will be in front of Terminal 1. https://t.co/OTjEZLnZgc https://t.co/flLtlbN7Gf

data.text: In normal times, cargo moves in the bellies of passenger planes. How do you keep cargo moving when you have fewer passenger flights than before? Read how @FinnairCargo rose to the challenge. https://t.co/4I6jctK3Dt

2020 was the most difficult year in aviation’s history. Finnair focused on building a path for itself through the pandemic. During 2020, we carried 3.5 million passengers and our revenue shrank to 829.2M€. https://t.co/ZJo3mXXjay

data.text: RT @HNoronenJuhola: The best way to create sustainable operations in aviation is to work together and break all silos. It´s in everybody´s…

We are today flying from HEL to KTT in collaboration with Fintraffic ANS to test how much fuel consumption can be decreased when we strive to optimise all parts of the flight. Did you know why an accurate departure time is important for fuel efficiency? https://t.co/FABNIQ1esX
RT @paivyttallqvist: Repair, reuse and recycle - applies also to aircraft. @Finnair Technical Services team is dismantling an A319 at end o…

Finnair gets set to recycle its A319 aircraft in Finland. This will be the first commercial airliner ever to be recycled in Finland. The project gives us the opportunity to employ our mechanics during a time when their normal workload has decreased. https://t.co/NQV1zyiv55

data.text: Did you know that airplanes are an unlikely place to catch viruses thanks to super-efficient air ventilation and filtering? HEPA filters remove 99.79% of bacteria and viruses and the air in cabins is completely changed every 3-7 minutes. https://t.co/DNt5DjgQh9
From the Northern Lights dancing across winter skies above Lapland to the hundreds of islands and sandy beaches of Helsinki’s archipelago, Finland is rich in natural wonders. https://t.co/DoFSKJLGak

From 28.1., we’ll require a certificate of a negative coronavirus test from customers arriving in Finland. It can be either printed or digital. The requirement does not apply to children under 12. Read more details about the updated guidance. https://t.co/L8txW6uPCe

We will require a negative covid-19 test certificate of all passengers on all Finnair flights to Finland from Jan 28 onwards. We will also re-start passenger flights from the UK and Ireland to Finland as of Jan 25. Pls read more: https://t.co/L8txW6uPCe

data.text:
"Almost 80 per cent of Finland’s land is forest; its lakes are among the clearest and its air the cleanest in the world."
https://t.co/PTYFjPTqNG

We will operate to the UK as follows: AY1337 HEL-LHR on 16.1., 17.1., 18.1., 23.1. and 24.1., and AY1331 HEL-LHR on 16.1., 17.1. and 23.1. We will operate AY1365 (HEL-MAN) and AY1373 (HEL-EDI) on 16.1. and 23.1. The return flights to HEL are operated as transfer flights.

Traficom has suspended passenger flights from the UK and Ireland to Finland until Jan 25 at 9:59 UTC. We are contacting customers whose flights are affected. Please see our Flight Information: https://t.co/wV8Hn0Ejxe

Let it snow! ❄️ We are keeping our traffic operating at HEL airport, despite the slight snow challenges – OH-LWM will head to HKG tomorrow. This picture also shows why some of our aircraft are in long-term parking in warmer climates. https://t.co/1h9zhr48MB

data.text: Finnair introduces one-way ticket fares for its flights within Europe. https://t.co/pftskwIkyN

We’ll operate the HEL-DUB-HEL flights AY1385 and AY1386 as normal on 9.1. We’ll also operate the following flights from HEL to the British Isles: AY1337 HEL-LHR 11.1., 13.1., 16.1. ja 17.1. and AY1331 HEL-LHR 17.1.
AY1373 HEL-EDI 16.1.
AY1365 HEL-MAN 16.1.

Traficom is continuing the suspension of passenger flights from the UK and also suspending passenger flights from Ireland and South Africa to Finland 11.-18.1.2021. We'll be in direct contact with customers whose flights are impacted.

The participants of the Finnair Virtual Holiday Flight to @VisitRovaniemi gathered more than 90,000€ for @unicef_finland's work to fight the Covid-19 pandemic. A huge thank you to everyone who boarded the Virtual Flight! https://t.co/8fZwGMnQsa

urls.title: Travel updates
urls.description: Helsinki Airport is the ideal place to start and finish your journey. All flights depart from and arrive in one terminal. We currently have delays in the refund handling due to a higher than normally volume of refund applications. Finnair leases an A320 aircraft from DAT LT from 20 June to 29 October 2022. Wearing a mask on our flights is optional, unless it is required by the authorities of your destination or origin country. We collected tips for you for smooth travelling during the busy summer season.

https://t.co/MRNnViYltC

data.text: In November, Finnair carried 85,000 passengers, which was 92.2% less than in the corresponding period of 2019 and 15.6% less than in October 2020. November was a very strong month for cargo. Read more: https://t.co/kDiHh28gdN https://t.co/EIJSxU0gWd

Here’s our CEO @TopiManner taking the ball 🌍 We work on the #GlobalGoals everyday. One of our key targets is to become a carbon neutral airline in 2045. But we cannot do it alone. We are lucky to have great partners already: We challenge our partner @NesteGlobal to #taketheball! https://t.co/eFQH29hb38
